metadata.title: CVE-2018-12376 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 61 and Firefox ESR 60.1. Some ofthese bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that withenough effort that some of these could be exploited to run arbitrary code.This vulnerability affects Firefox < 62, Firefox ESR < 60.2, andThunderbird < 60.2.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12376` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 62.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '62.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.2.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
